website_summaries.verdict: This impressive pair offers supreme weather protection alongside luxurious, helpful  features.
pros: Exterior pocket located on mitt for easy access to smaller items
Waterproof, breathable fabric with 2-layer build for supreme warmth
cons: Not the best options for snowboarding
Material supporting palm could be higher quality

customer_reviews.title: OK for warmth...terrible for snowboarding. Cheap plastic-like material on the palm.
customer_reviews.text: Awesome glove for freezing temperatures...in the not so cold simply remove the liners.However, the palm is not very durable.They ripped on the first wear. I went don't a steep icy black diamond and dragged my hand for a second and the thumb and palm are now frayed. They look like they were dragged behind a car. The material that the palm is made out of is cheap and plastic like. If you want these for sports I'd think twice. I had a NorthFace Montana mittens that lasted 3 years through worse conditions. They are warm if you're just using them to keep your hands warm and not for actual snowboarding.
customer_reviews.author: Ty3140

customer_reviews.title: NOT Burton Quality
customer_reviews.text: Snowboarded 2x and the stitching is failing. The stitching at the tip of the middle finger on the left handed glove has separated. It's coming apart, so now gortex doesn't matter because moisture can now come in freely. This glove is the one that I use to unstrap my boot so I can go on the chair lift, so it's used the most. The crappiest part is that it's been 6 weeks since it shipped and it can no longer be returned. That's crap. Should've purchased through REI.
customer_reviews.author: truthBtold

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Mitts
customer_reviews.text: Mitts Look Awesome. They feel great and the touch screen capabaility works pretty well. Get ready to type one thumb only. Trying them on the mountain this weekend. If I don't leave a followup review, that means they performed great. Only complaint is the tags. Jeez, Burton. Way to make the itchiest tags ever. I had to cut them down extremely close and burn them back so my wrist wouldn't itch every second. Other than the tags, which really is nbd, these are awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Alexandra M

customer_reviews.title: Blown away impressed!
customer_reviews.text: I haven’t taken them on the mountain yet, but let me tell you I am extremely impressed with these mittens. All of the mechanics make sure the glove is on as tight as possible with straps on hand and wrist after on. The mechanics are amazing and make it very easy to tighten and loosen while wearing gloves too. Plus the pocket to be able to put hand warmers in is a huge plus. As well as the inner glove has sticky lining which I love so it sticks in the mitten for better control plus for your touch screen phone. Would highly highly recommend these gloves to anybody!
customer_reviews.author: Steve-o

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase.
customer_reviews.text: Love these mittens. I have large hands so putting on gloves and taking them off throughout the day is a pain. The liners are nice, though I bought silk liners as well because these are warmer than I was used to when compared to gloves. These are a true mitten (no fingered liner inside like some brands) which is nice when it comes to drying. They flip inside out easily so I was able to enjoy dry hand protection for our week in the snow. The wrist straps are also really nice. First pair of gloves with those and I don’t think I could ever go back.
customer_reviews.author: Will O

customer_reviews.title: good for the price, warm and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I paid $48 for these which seems like a good price. I’m 5/9” and 145 pounds with smallish thin hands. The medium was a little too big and the small was perfect. They were warm enough skiing in Park City in March that I didn’t need the liners or insertable warmers. I haven’t worn them much so I can’t attest to their durability. My review is based on value, comfort and warmth.
customer_reviews.author: PC MountainTop Contributor: Cycling

customer_reviews.title: Under gloves fit nicely inside pocket!
customer_reviews.text: These gloves are lightweight, warm, and provide good coverage. I like how they come with under gloves, which fit inside the zippered pocket. If your fingers get cold, they are there for you. I ended up receiving the wrong color because the color names are too similar (heather vs heather new). You may want to add an additional instruction to ensure you get the desired color.
customer_reviews.author: Trev

customer_reviews.title: dont
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these expensive mits believing they would keep my hands warmer than regular gloves of the same price category. They do NOT perform any better than the two olther pairs of standard gloves in temps of upper 40s.
customer_reviews.author: Smart Consumer

customer_reviews.title: These are worth it!
customer_reviews.text: It's been a cold winter in Michigan. My gloves (five digits for thumb and four fingers on each) barely kept me warm, especially if there was any 'wind.' I bought these, and paid a high price (for me). They work! They keep my hands warm, are adjustable at the wrist, and have an 'inner' glove should you need to remove a mitten. Not perfect, but satisfactory and meets my need to keep my hands warm for my 90 minute walk/runs.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good gloves but a bit pricey
customer_reviews.text: The gloves arrived on time. The inner glove fits somewhat snug but acceptable. I wore the gloves in cold and windy weather and they kept my hands warm enough. I would say that they are good for temperatures of 20 degrees and up, especially if you are active. My son has the Burton's gloves with the inner lining sewn in and I think that they are warmer gloves. I would give it 5 stars but for the price I would expect the gloves to keep my hands warm down to zero.
customer_reviews.author: Edward Wood

customer_reviews.title: Not very warm
customer_reviews.text: The palm side of the glove has almost no insulation, it's just an interior shell and the exterior material, that's it. Strangely, the top part does have. Without the gauntlets that it comes with they are basically useless, and with the gauntlets they are kind of uncomfortable. Touchscreen compatibility is a plus
customer_reviews.author: VK

customer_reviews.title: Glove
customer_reviews.text: Haven't used them yet, but not much insulation in the gloves. The inserts are thick so it may give you some warms on extremely cold days. I had SWANY in the past and they were great, but very, very pricey. I will try them next skiing season, but if they don't keep my hands warms I will go back to SWANY.
customer_reviews.author: John DeCristofano

customer_reviews.title: warm
customer_reviews.text: Buy gore tex gloves if you want dry hands. I've been skiing for most of my adult life and always buy gore tex mitten. These come with a liner but I don't use the liner unless it is below zero out. These are great for a day out skiing.
customer_reviews.author: That guy again

customer_reviews.title: 2 in 1 glove and mitten kit
customer_reviews.text: Like: The gloves made removing the mittens and putting them on again so much easier when my hands were wet after skiing, While the mittens were useful for holding the ski poles, the finger gloves made everything else easy. Dislike: Because it is 2 in 1 kit, the mittens will look slightly bigger. For men, I don't think it is a big deal.
customer_reviews.author: dlee

customer_reviews.title: Good Mittens - Touch Screen Gloves May Need Replacing
customer_reviews.text: Mittens are good and the mitten portion can work on your touchscreen - so could answer a call. But, the liner gloves DO NOT work on the touchscreen. So if you want to draft an email/text on the chair lift, it gets difficult as the mittens are too big to do that kind of work. Next version should have a couple fingertips on the gloves that work with touchscreens and this would be a 5 Star. UPDATE: called Burton and they are sending some liners that should work with the touch screen. Seems like every now and then, some of the liners may not work - Give 5 STARS to Burton for service.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good purchase
customer_reviews.text: First time wore them in Swiss Alps. Hands kept warm all day and the inserts were good call since my hands got sweaty. The added zipper on the top part for the lift pass was an amazing added feature. I never even tried to use the touch screen option so not sure if they actually work on that aspect. Overall Little expensive but definitely will get my money worth out of them.
customer_reviews.author: kelly l

customer_reviews.title: Great Gloves

The wrist pulls tighten the mitten as much as you need, and easily adjustable, even with a mitten on the other hand! Seem to wear well , no scrapes or marring of the materials, even after a full 7 hours of tubing. Wish the mittens were cheaper, but worth the price, I must admit

Very well made and designed.

customer_reviews.title: Solid value

When conditions are wet, consider bringing an extra pair of liners, swap them out during lunch and you're back in business for the second half of the day. In colder/powder conditions, these held up great -- hands stayed warm and dry.

customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Snowboarding season is pretty much dunzo in California but I'll update this review once I take these mitts to Colorado. Fits as expected.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Manuel

customer_reviews.title: Good quality gloves with all the great features I've grown ...
customer_reviews.text: Good quality gloves with all the great features I've grown to love from Burton. I usually wear regular gloves and thought I'd try mitts as I'm starting to have trouble keeping my hands warm. Really I didn't notice a difference so I'll probably go back to gloves when I wear these out, which should be several years from now.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great gloves. My boyfriend loves them and loves how warm his hands stay when snowboarding.
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany

customer_reviews.title: Finally, something that keeps my hands dry and warm all day
customer_reviews.text: Holy s*** does my hand sweat while snowboarding --not that I'm complaining while everything else I've worn or borrowed from friends gear couldn't compare! When you're on the mountain for 8+ hrs, most gear gets snow, slowly freezes, and then your hands are wet and cold, but not with these!
customer_reviews.author: 7an

customer_reviews.title: Love these Mittens
customer_reviews.text: Love these mittens. Went to keystone rode hard for 2 days it was pretty warm I did not get to test the inside gloves for warmth bur the outer mitten is rock solid. Even when I got snow in them from wiping out or just from sweating in them they dried out with the top vent open going down the hill. I highly recommend this product. I never measured my hand but I wear a large to extra large and regular work gloves and the large fit just right.
customer_reviews.author: Roll_N

product_meta.title: Burton Gore-Tex Mittens Mens
product_meta.description: The life of a mitt is not easy. More than any other part of your riding kit, mitts have the most contact with the elements. With that in mind, pros choose the bestselling Burton GORE-TEX Mitt + Gore warm technology. DRYRIDE 2L fabric, and a GUARANTEED TO KEEP YOU DRY GORE-TEX membrane protect this Thermacore insulated mitt from downright rugged winter conditions. The Screen Grab synthetic leather palm gives you stealth touchscreen control using tech that will never fray, wear out, or wash off. A removable four-way stretch fleece liner dries quickly and gives you options for any weather. Wear just the liner when shoveling, just the shell in sloppy spring conditions, or combine the two for total midwinter warmth and comfort.
feature_bullets: Screen Grab Toughgrip Palm for Total Touchscreen Control
